panels.description: The total messages per second across all topics in the cluster.
panels.title: Total Messages

panels.description: The total bytes per second across all topics in this cluster.
panels.title: Total Bytes

panels.description: The first node to boot in a Kafka cluster automatically becomes the controller, and there can be only one. The controller in a Kafka cluster is responsible for maintaining the list of partition leaders, and coordinating leadership transitions (in the event a partition leader becomes unavailable). If it becomes necessary to replace the controller, a new controller is randomly chosen by ZooKeeper from the pool of brokers. In general, it is not possible for this value to be greater than one, but you should definitely alert on a value of zero that lasts for more than a short period (< 1s) of time.
panels.title: Active Controllers

panels.description: In a healthy cluster, the number of in sync replicas (ISRs) should be exactly equal to the total number of replicas. If partition replicas fall too far behind their leaders, the follower partition is removed from the ISR pool, and you should see a corresponding increase in IsrShrinksPerSec. Since Kafka’s high-availability guarantees cannot be met without replication, investigation is certainly warranted should this metric value exceed zero for extended time periods.
panels.title: Under Replicated

panels.description: This metric reports the number of partitions without an active leader. Because all read and write operations are only performed on partition leaders, a non-zero value for this metric should be alerted on to prevent service interruptions. Any partition without an active leader will be completely inaccessible, and both consumers and producers of that partition will be blocked until a leader becomes available.
panels.title: Offline Partitions

panels.description: The first node to boot in a Kafka cluster automatically becomes the controller, and there can be only one. The controller in a Kafka cluster is responsible for maintaining the list of partition leaders, and coordinating leadership transitions (in the event a partition leader becomes unavailable). If partition replicas fall too far behind their leaders, the follower partition is removed from the ISR pool, and you should see a corresponding increase in IsrShrinksPerSec. Any partition without an active leader will be completely inaccessible, and both consumers and producers of that partition will be blocked until a leader becomes available.
panels.title: Offline Partitions

panels.description: The maximum lag in terms of number of records for any partition in this window. An increasing value over time is your best indication that the consumer group is not keeping up with the producers.
panels.title: Consumer Records Lag Max

panels.description: The average number of records consumed per second.
panels.title: Consumed

panels.description: The average number of records produced per second.
panels.title: Produced
